metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19951 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20190423 Q8, there is a heap-based buffer overflow in the function ImportRLEPixels of coders/miff.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1').
